ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to produce quality prose. And that metaphors are difficult to get right.

I learned how to write so much more clearly and rhythmically. Previously the meaning of my sentences frequently got lost in complicated syntax, but Verlyn taught me how to slow down and make my meaning known.

This course greatly improved the clarity of my writing. My progress was tangible, which was satisfying. I have never taken a Yale course where I felt like I was learning an actual, useful skill that applies not only to my academics, but the rest of my life.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was a lovely class. Everyone was a little shy in the beginning, though, which made the discussions less vibrant.

Verlyn is an awesome professor. He's committed to every student's growth as a writer and is only a little bit scary (at first).  One strength is definitely the format - writing 2 pages every week. It's a challenging exercise, but the consistency is really useful for improving and practicing writing.

Strengths: Professor Verlyn is AMAZING. You get clear feedback. You get to write about whatever you want each week. Everyone's piece gets workshopped during the semester. You learn how to be critical of what you write and read. A super awesome class overall. 
Weakness: Not really a weakness, but the two page assignment each weak sounds easy/quick. It's not! Also, the assignments were due on Saturday this semester, but Friday would've been a nicer due date.

There are only strengths, no weaknesses. The assignment of two pages a week is very manageable, and I looked forward to writing every week. The feedback I got on my papers was always clear and helpful. The only improvement would be if this class was a year long, or four years long. That's how amazing it is.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but you should want to improve your writing and be invested in that process.

YES! You learn so much, and you will see improvement in your writing. This isn't a class where you have to be good at writing already- you'll become good! Professor Verlyn really cares about his students and is super encouraging!

Yes! Above all, the community built by the course is warm and welcoming. If you like writing, or if youre looking to improve your writing, this is the place to do it. The pace of the course is very helpful, and the structure of the class made the time pass quickly. I loved going to class every week, and so would highly recommend the course.

Yes, I would recommend this to everyone and anyone. There is no wrong person for a class like this. If you like to write, or want to get better at it, I can think of no better course for you than this one.
